# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load
import math  
import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.e9649735:
def calc_corr(n,x,y,x2,y2,xy):
    print('(n * sum(xy) - sum(x) * sum(y))/(√(n * sum(x²) - sum(x)²) * √(n * sum(y²) - sum(y)²))')
    print('(%s * %s - %s * %s)/(√(%s * %s - %s²) * √(%s * %s - %s²))' % (n, sum(xy), sum(x), sum(y), n, sum(x2), sum(x), n, sum(y2), sum(y)))
    print('(%s - %s)/(√(%s - %s) * √(%s - %s))' % (n * sum(xy), sum(x) * sum(y), n * sum(x2), sum(x)*sum(x), n * sum(y2), sum(y) * sum(y)))
    print('%s/(√%s * √%s)' % (n * sum(xy) - sum(x) * sum(y), n * sum(x2) - sum(x)*sum(x), n * sum(y2) - sum(y) * sum(y)))
    print('%s/(%.2f * %.2f)' % (n * sum(xy) - sum(x) * sum(y), math.sqrt(n * sum(x2) - sum(x)*sum(x)), math.sqrt(n * sum(y2) - sum(y) * sum(y))))
    print('%s/%.2f' % (n * sum(xy) - sum(x) * sum(y), math.sqrt(n * sum(x2) - sum(x)*sum(x))* math.sqrt(n * sum(y2) - sum(y) * sum(y))))
    print('%.2f' % ((n * sum(xy) - sum(x) * sum(y))/(math.sqrt(n * sum(x2) - sum(x)*sum(x))* math.sqrt(n * sum(y2) - sum(y) * sum(y)))))
source.88458d00:
def tendency_line_equation(n,x,y,x2,y2,xy):
    print('Equação da reta ajustada = ax + b\n')
    print('a = (n * sum(xy) - sun(x) * sum(y))/n * sum(x²) - sum(x)²')
    print('a = (%s * %s - %s * %s)/(%s * %s - %s²)' % (n, sum(xy), sum(x), sum(y), n, sum(x2), sum(x)))
    print('a = (%s - %s)/(%s - %s)' % (n * sum(xy), sum(x) * sum(y), n * sum(x2), sum(x)*sum(x)))
    print('a = %s/%s' % (n * sum(xy)- sum(x) * sum(y), n * sum(x2)- sum(x)*sum(x)))
    a = (n * sum(xy)- sum(x) * sum(y))/(n * sum(x2)- sum(x)*sum(x))
    print('a = %.2f\n' % a)

    print('b = sum(y)/n - a * sum(x)/n')
    print('b = %s/%s - %.2f * %s/%s' % (sum(y),n,a, sum(x),n))
    print('b = %.2f - %.2f * %.2f' % (sum(y)/n,a, sum(x)/n))
    print('b = %.2f - %.2f' % (sum(y)/n,a* sum(x)/n))
    b = (sum(y)/n)-(a* sum(x)/n)
    print('b = %.2f\n' % (b))

    print('Equação da reta ajustada = %.2fx + %.2f' % (a,b))
    
    return (a,b)
source.cbe64674:
x = [1,2,3,4,5,6]
y = [70,50,40,30,20,10]
n = len(x)
x2 = [x[i]*x[i] for i in range(n)]
y2 = [y[i]*y[i] for i in range(n)]
xy = [x[i]*y[i] for i in range(n)]
pd.DataFrame({'x': x,'y': y,'x²': x2, 'y²': y2, 'xy': xy})
